javadoc:
ProgramDiffDetails is used to determine the detailed differences between
 two programs at a particular address. The differences are determined for
 the extent of the code units from each program at a particular address.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: p1
params.comment: the original program

params.name: p2
params.comment: the program to diff against.

methods.name: getDiffDetails
methods.comment:
Gets a string indicating the types of differences for the code units at the indicated
 address. The string contains information from each program where there are differences.
 It containing multiple lines separated by newline characters)

params.name: p1
params.comment: the original program

params.name: p2
params.comment: the program to diff against.

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

methods.name: getDiffDetails
methods.comment:
Gets a string indicating the types of differences for the code units at the indicated
 address. The string contains information from each program where there are differences.
 It containing multiple lines separated by newline characters)

params.name: p1
params.comment: the original program

params.name: p2
params.comment: the program to diff against.

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

params.name: filter
params.comment: the program diff filter that indicates the diff details to show.

methods.name: getDiffDetails
methods.comment:
Gets a string indicating the types of differences for the code units at the indicated
 address. The string contains information from each program where there are differences.
 It containing multiple lines separated by newline characters)

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

methods.name: getDiffDetails
methods.comment:
Gets a string indicating the types of differences for the code units at the indicated
 address. The string contains information from each program where there are differences.
 It containing multiple lines separated by newline characters)

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

params.name: filter
params.comment: the program diff filter that indicates the diff details to show.

methods.name: getAllDetails
methods.comment:
Determine the detailed differences between the two programs at the
 indicated address. The differences are determined for the extent of the
 code units in the two programs at the indicated address.

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

params.name: doc
params.comment:
the document where the details of differences between the two
 programs should be written.

params.name: prefixString
params.comment: Line of text to display at beginning of the difference details information.

methods.name: getDetails
methods.comment:
Determine the detailed differences between the two programs at the
 indicated address. The differences are determined for the extent of the
 code units in the two programs at the indicated address.

params.name: p1DiffAddress
params.comment:
the address that difference details are needed for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

params.name: filter
params.comment: the program diff filter that indicates the diff details to show.

params.name: doc
params.comment:
the document where the details of differences between the two
 programs should be written.

params.name: prefixString
params.comment: Line of text to display at beginning of the difference details information.

methods.name: getDetailsAddressSet
methods.comment:
Gets the address set where detailed differences will be determined for details at the
 indicated address. An address set is returned since the indicated address may be in different
 sized code units in each of the two programs.

params.name: p1Address
params.comment:
the current address where details are desired.
 This address may be from program1 or program2.

return.comment: the program1 address set for code units containing that address within the programs being diffed.

methods.name: addByteInfo
methods.comment: Adds a string to the details indicating the address with byte differences and the byte values.

params.name: p1Address
params.comment:
the address to get the bytes for.
 This address should be derived from program1.

params.name: addrLength
params.comment: the length of the address field.

params.name: mem1
params.comment: the first program's memory for obtaining the bytes

params.name: mem2
params.comment: the second program's memory.

methods.javadoc: @param addr
methods.name: addEntryPtLine
sameSymbols
methods.comment: Determines whether the two arrays of symbols are equal.

params.name: s1
params.comment: first array of symbols

params.name: s2
params.comment: second array of symbols

return.comment: true if the arrays of symbols are equal.

methods.name: addDisplayLabel
methods.comment: Gets a string indicating the label name and its attributes.

params.name: symbol
params.comment: the symbol to get the name and attributes for.

params.name: nameLength
params.comment: the length of the name field.

params.name: typeLength
params.comment: the length of the type field.

params.name: sourceLength
params.comment: the length of the source field.

return.comment: the string with the label name and attributes.

methods.javadoc: @param opIndex
methods.name: addOperandText

methods.javadoc:
Gets the Diff Details for the program context registers.
@throws ConcurrentModificationException if analysis is modifying the program context.
methods.name: addProgramContextDetails
methods.comment: Gets the Diff Details for the program context registers.

throws.comment: if analysis is modifying the program context.

methods.name: addRegisterDiffDetails
methods.comment: Adds the Diff Details for the indicated register to the details document.

params.name: pc1
params.comment: first program's register context

params.name: pc2
params.comment: second program's register context

params.name: reg1
params.comment: the register

throws.comment: if analysis is modifying the program context.

methods.name: addTagDetails
methods.comment: Displays tag differences if they exist between the two functions.

params.name: doc1
params.comment: text to show for program 1

params.name: doc2
params.comment: text to show for program 2

methods.name: getTagInfo
methods.comment:
Constructs a comma-delimited string from the names of all function
 tags passed-in. If a comment is present in the tag object, it will be shown
 in parenthesis.

methods.name: sameBookmarks
methods.comment: Determines whether or not two arrays of bookmarks are equal.

params.name: marks1
params.comment: first array of bookmarks

params.name: marks2
params.comment: second array of bookmarks

return.comment: true if the two bookmark arrays are equal.

methods.javadoc:
Adds multiple bookmarks to the details.
@param marks the bookmarks to add.
methods.name: addBookmarks
methods.comment: Adds multiple bookmarks to the details.

params.name: marks
params.comment: the bookmarks to add.

methods.name: isSameData
methods.comment: Returns whether the two defined data objects are the same.

params.name: d1
params.comment: the first defined data object

params.name: d2
params.comment: the second defined data object

return.comment: true if the defeined data objects are the same.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a formatted difference string for an individual line difference
 between program1 and program2.
methods.name: addDiffString
methods.comment:
Creates a formatted difference string for an individual line difference
 between program1 and program2.

name: ProgramDiffDetails
comment:
ProgramDiffDetails is used to determine the detailed differences between
 two programs at a particular address. The differences are determined for
 the extent of the code units from each program at a particular address.
